comment: Quizzes are doable, no tests, had to sign up for 3 events for credit but was an easy A because its 40% of your grade. Everything was manageable and stayed on top of everything last semester. The facility report project is the hardest thing about the class but turn it in early and youll get feedback to fix your problems for a better grade.
Took him in summer and was very easy to manage. Great guy, definitely recommend taking him

Dr. Johnson is a great professor, highly recommend taking him. Gives clear guidance and grading. His exams questions are straight from the book and lectures however, he words them slightly different so pay attention. Utilize your time wisely in his classes and pay attention.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Johnson is a highly fair professor. Do not expect just definitions on his quizzes, you will need to know the material and dig into the book. I found this class quite interesting. The old saying goes, you get what you put into it---can't "C" your way out of Dr. Johnson's tests. Definitely a great course and a great professor.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Dr. Johnson is all about you learning from experiences, which I think is something other professors should take notice of. With guest speakers that come in to give advice in the related fields, it is something that many would take for granted. He asks that you show up to class. If you do that then the rest of the course will take care of itself.

The online class involves tonss of classes and lots of busy work.  For the summer, you have multiple quizzes every week, whole semester walking labs, weekly labs, keeping track of fitness, and many discussions.  Don't take unless you have lots of time over the summer.  Very tedious.

Dr. Johnson is a very laid back professor, always willing to help his students out. His personality is tough to adjust to at first as he is very sarcastic and very opinionated but this creates deeper thinking and discussion in class. Overall a great professor and I would definitely take him again!
At first the structure for his online class might be very confusing, but once you get the hang out if the class is pretty easy. You need the textbook, and need to participate in the discussions.

This class is a pretty easy A. You can do it at your own pace. You could finish it in a month or take your time with it. The assignments are clear and easy. The quizzes come straight from the book, but can be a bit challenging. Johnson doesn't reply quickly to his emails, it sometimes seems like he forgets about his class. But this is an easy A!

Dr. J, as he goes by Is a wonderful professor, he has taken the time throughout our online course consisting of 90+ students, and helped each of us through email, and discussion boards. If you have a question, he tries to get back promptly, the book I suggest rent online, it is NEEDED. I recommend this professor for any student, excellent prof.

This was a great course and Dr. Johnson has done a great job setting it up. It is pretty much a self paced course with a few peer responses and deadlines. There is a lot of work. There are reading assignments, quizzes, projects, assessments, and activities. Read the syllabus and follow the rubric and an 'A' is easily attainable.

Lots of lectures, don't take notes he won't give you time to copy them down. Read the book and study the notes online. Take him online if you can! Hes sarcastic and funny, but slightly rude and its so hard to study for his tests. No idea what he is even testing us on. We mostly just BS about sports in class. Tests are so hard.
Great Professor. He is absolutely helpful. It's a lot of information to cover for the semester, but if you do the work, you'll be fine.
Took Dr. Johnson's online class.  The assignments were easy and he was pretty laid back about the due dates. He was definitely willing to go out of his way to help you. I recommend him.

I took Dr. Johnson's online class during the summer. Dr. Johnson is a great professor. He really wants his students to exceed and goes out of his way to help them. He has always been quick to reply back and extremely helpful. I would highly recommend Dr. Johnson to anyone.

Nice guy who likes to have fun. Class is easy as long as you do the big stuff. No tests just small quizzes. The big projects are the majority of the class. Only problem is he isn't clear on when things are due because he is so relaxed.
Laid back and easy going.
The class was super easy. He has an interesting way of grading that allowed me to earn an A without doing the Pedometer Project or taking the final. Not a lot of work was required to earn an easy A.

Co-teaching class shared with Scheck. At times the two seemed to not be insinc with one another, espcially where testing information was concerned. He knows his stuff but should stop asking where the students are on any given day. He should hold them accoutable for not attending class until test day.

Probably my favorite teacher at KSU so far... He doesn't take attendance except on activity days, doesn't care if you dress out, tests are super easy he gives you the study guide. He's a funny guy who knows his stuff he is definitely worth taking. He makes a Gen. Ed. class interesting, and I actually learned more in here than most classes. Take him
This professor actually knows what he is talking about.Treats even us older students with respect Can't wait to take 1810.Come to class and participate for an "A"
If you go to class even half the time and do the assignments, you'll have no trouble getting a good grade.
Loved the class. Extremely nice, and understanding. Turn your work in and you wont have any problems, just stay on top of the assignments.

One of the nicest professors you could wish to have.  Dr. Johnson is very kind, sympathetic, and sweet.  I don't understand previous raters calling him disorganized as his class organization seemed at a normal level to me.  I learned a lot in his class and his activities were so much fun.  A caring professor who created a fun learning environment.
Funny and friendly. Slightly disorganized and gets irritated when you want to clarify something. Several assignments to complete, but easy work.
Awesome teacher! I would highly reccomend him.

Nice guy.  Creates a familiar atmosphere without distracting from class.  Likes people who show up and participate; really dislikes people who talk in lecture or try to sneak out early.  Certain out-of-class projects have to happen at KSU, but if you can't do those you can still get an A by doing the other labs and studying/reading for the tests.

Really nice guy. Lectures were interesting and funny. Test were taken from the book and lectures. Must read book to do well on test. He was a little diorganized when it came to posting grades and test reviews on WebCT.

Good teacher, gives a few homework assignments(ie pedometer, diet analysis, etc.) But all are easy, rewards you for going to class.  He gives extra credit and it's easy stuff,expects you to read the book is the only down side. Great Teacher! Very cool, very fun, you play games a bunch too!
He is so cute! Class is fun, as long as you do your homework. Can be hard at times...good conversation...nice to look at too!
Be prepared.  You will have no idea what is expected of you.  Ask him questions during and after class to clarify.  Nice guy, but is not yet a good professor.
Class was fun, but tests were hard. he was a fun teacher, so that's always good.

Test were not easy, you really have to study for them. But be sure and talk with him after class and meet with him and talk about tests, he will help you as long as you show that you need help and are willing to do the work
Good, nice professor.  Quizzes were a little off the notes, but otherwise a pretty good class.  Not hard to make an A.
Pretty easy and straightforward, nice guy.
